comments.author: b1437400@klzlk.com
comments.creator: b1437400@klzlk.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:9.0a1) Gecko/20110827 Firefox/9.0a1
Build ID: 20110827030801

Steps to reproduce:

1. Download the archive http://dl.dropbox.com/u/11652751/1.rar - it containts a pure html page with a ton of gifs.
It's about 135mb in the packed state
2. Unrar the archive
3. Open the page inside of it
4. Watch memory consumption by firefox process


Actual results:

+650mb instantly increased RAM consumption


Expected results:

Chrome eats +170mb in that case

comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.raw_text: Presumably a duplicate of the bug on us decoding all frames of an animated gif....
comments.text: Presumably a duplicate of the bug on us decoding all frames of an animated gif....

comments.raw_text: Yeah, that's probably part of it.  Chrome is also using less CPU than us, which makes me think that they're only animating the GIFs in view, but I didn't investigate much.
comments.text: Yeah, that's probably part of it.  Chrome is also using less CPU than us, which makes me think that they're only animating the GIFs in view, but I didn't investigate much.

comments.raw_text: I've added bug 666446 as a blocking of this one, I don't understand if they are the same or not.

comments.author: khuey@kylehuey.com
comments.creator: khuey@kylehuey.com
comments.text: That bug will help with the CPU usage here.  It may or may not help with the memory usage (I didn't read the patches in detail).
comments.raw_text: That bug will help with the CPU usage here.  It may or may not help with the memory usage (I didn't read the patches in detail).

comments.author: jmuizelaar@mozilla.com
comments.creator: jmuizelaar@mozilla.com
comments.text: Apparently bug 595671 will allow us to discard images.
comments.raw_text: Apparently bug 595671 will allow us to discard images.

comments.text: [Clearing dependency on bug 666446, since that bug's not intended to help with memory usage as khuey suggested in comment 4]
